Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

```
assign implies __unsafe_unretained ownership.
copy implies __strong ownership, as well as the usual behavior of copy semantics on the setter.
retain implies __strong ownership.
strong implies __strong ownership.
unsafe_unretained implies __unsafe_unretained ownership.
weak implies __weak ownership.
```

Post._content:
# RunLoop
>A NSRunLoop object processes input for sources such as mouse and keyboard events from the window system, NSPort objects, and NSConnection objects. A NSRunLoop object also processes NSTimer events.

## RunLoop 

OSX/iOS `NSRunLoop`  `CFRunLoopRef`
`CFRunLoopRef`  `CoreFoundation`  C  API API 
`NSRunLoop`  `CFRunLoopRef`  API API 

## Input source  Timer source
`Input source`  `Timer source` RunLoop 

### Input Source 
- Port-Based Sources Port `CFSocketRef`
- Custom Input Sources
- Cocoa Perform Selector SourcesCocoa `performSelector`

### Timer Source
`NSTimer`

## RunLoop 
 RunLoop   Dictionary  RunLoopRunLoop RunLoop  RunLoop()

 RunLoop  input source  timer source 
![RunLoop](/images/objc_runloop.jpg)

### Warning
>The NSRunLoop class is generally not considered to be thread-safe and its methods should only be called within the context of the current thread. You should never try to call the methods of an NSRunLoop object running in a different thread, as doing so might cause unexpected results.

## RunLoop Observer
RunLoop  Source  RunLoop Observer  RunLoop 

RunLoop Observer  RunLoop 
- The entrance to the run loop.
- When the run loop is about to process a timer.
- When the run loop is about to process an input source.
- When the run loop is about to go to sleep.
- When the run loop has woken up, but before it has processed the event that woke it up.
- The exit from the run loop.
